newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Mint to sell first platinum coins June 6.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Mint to sell first platinum coins June 6.

text.p: The U.S. Mint is set to start selling the first platinum coins in U.S. history on June 6, Mint Director Philip Diehl said.
Production strikes of the Proof Platinum American Eagle were struck last week at the West Point Mint, Diehl said.

The coins will be available in 1-ounce, half-ounce, quarter-ounce and one-tenth-ounce denominations, the popular Four Coin set, and also in a three-coin "Impressions of Liberty" set featuring 1-ounce platinum, gold and silver bullion coins which will be offered this year only.

Prices for the individual Proof Platinum American Eagles are: $695 for the 1-ounce; $395 for the half-ounce; $199 for the quarter-ounce, and $99 for the tenth-ounce. The Four Coin set is $1,350 and the three-coin "Impressions of Liberty" set is $1,499.
The 1-ounce carries a $100 face value, the half-ounce a $50 face value, the quarter-ounce a $25 face value and the tenth-ounce a $10 face value.
The Platinum Eagles will be available until Dec. 31, 1997 or until sold out.
